sub_topic: Finding the determinant of a matrix
message_2:
To find the determinant of a 2x2 matrix, we use the formula:

det(A) = ad - bc

where A is the given matrix:
\begin{bmatrix}
a & b \\
c & d
\end{bmatrix}

In this case, a = 5, b = 7, c = 3, and d = 4. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

det(A) = (5)(4) - (7)(3) = 20 - 21 = -1

So the determinant of the given matrix is -1.
